results.title: Native bears
results.creator_credit: Keith Hutchison, Kingcroft Productions and William Horne
results.brief_description: A simple study of the life and habits of the koalas and wombats, both of which have been called native bears. They are compared with the marsupial tiger and the opossum. Presents the animals in their natural surroundings; wombats drinking at a stream; koalas feeding on gum leaves with their young in their pouches.

results.title: Native Africa
results.brief_description: Short travelogue that moves from Capetown to Victoria Falls in the Zambezi. Shows friendly natives and not-so-friendly animals. Also talks about the achievements of Cecil Rhodes and David Livingstone

results.title: Nationalised industries: Ministerial power : case study
results.brief_description: Title on container: Fuel Policy;”SUMMARY: Leslie Wagner discusses ministerial power in relation to the issue of nationalised industry in Britain, in particular, the Fuel Policy which was developed in early 1970 against the background of the coal strikes o

results.title: National Youth Theatre
results.creator_credit: John Bloom, Melstrum Films and John Crome
results.brief_description: Young people from 110 different schools in Britain, take part in the annual National Youth Theatre production. Established in 1956, it has formed 85 other youth theatres all over Britain. Its aim is to help young people enjoy the theatre by participating in it and finding out what goes into making a play and its production. Shows rehearsals leading up to a full scale production of “Coriolanus” in the West End theatre. Some lovely footage of London in 1965.

results.title: National Velvet (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Pandro S. Berman, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Clarence Brown
results.brief_description: Based on the novel “National Velvet” by Enid Bagnold, this is the incredible story of a girl who rides to victory in the celebrated Grand National at Aintree, England. Velvet Brown, a young girl passionately interested in horses wins a horse in a raffle and with the help of Mi, an ex-jockey, sets out to win the greatest steeplechase in the world, the Grand National. Stars Elizabeth Taylor and Mickey Rooney. Rated: G

results.title: National income and economic policy: the supply of money
results.creator_credit: Peter Ramsden, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: This program describes in some detail money supply and the institutions which are concerned in it; it also examinesa the various constraints which make the control of the money supply a difficult matter. The program was made in early 1972, before the monetary system had adapted itself completely to the new arrangements introduced by the Bank of England in late 1971.

results.title: National Geographic: beyond the movie. "The Lord of the rings: the fellowship of the ring"
results.creator_credit: Kathleen Phelan and National Geographic Television
results.brief_description: Peter Jackson’s “Lord of the rings” trilogy brought the world of Tolkien’s Middle Earth to the big screen and gave visual presence to an era familiar to a legion of fans. This presentation from “National Geographic” seeks to find the inspiration and influences behind Tolkien’s work and the relevance of the quest today. Issues covered include the origins of the Elvish language and the race of hobbits, the impact of mass industrialization to the detriment of the environment, the onset of World War I, and Anglo-Saxon culture as presented in “Beowulf” on Tolkien’s writing. Includes interviews with cast members, director Peter Jackson, publisher and personal friend of Tolkien, Ray Unwin, historians and archaeologists, and location scouts for the film who provide fascinating details about re-creating Middle Earth. Narrated by Phil Crowley.
